page.title: 17MR. PALMER (continued)
page.content: carrying oil or coal. On September 18th l955, Lord Noel Buxtun walked right across the River Severn guided by Mr. Palmer's knowledge of the floor of the River Severn. The lowest point of which was between Aylburton and Shepperdine. They devised a zig zag course. This was the old Roman Ford. At the deepest point the water came to Lord Buxtun's chest, but it was completed successfully. Mr. Palmer cannot remember any crashes near the lighthouse. There were two trow boats, the Little Billy and the Little Willy which carried mostly stone, coal and bricks between Wales and Oldbury. The trow boats had three sails, the fore sail, stay sail and main sail. The yacht club was started about 25 or 30 years ago, by Edmund Grace (brother of the cricketer) and Captain
